ai_choice.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Choice

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Page
ai_page.body:
Daily visitor vouchers

Daily Visitor Vouchers are credit-card style passes that enable entry to members’ guests when accompanied by a member. They can be used either for an individual day or several visits over a week.

  • Cost per voucher: £2.20
  • Valid Monday to Friday, 10am–6pm
  • Vouchers are non-refundable and non-transferable

How to buy visitor vouchers

  1. Log in to your account via the members’ area.
  2. Select 'Buy daily visitor vouchers'.
  3. Complete payment by card online.
  4. Your voucher(s) will be sent to your registered address.
Please note: All guests must be accompanied by a member at all times while on site.

For further assistance, contact our membership team.

ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Page
ai_page.body:
Visitor Vouchers

Visitor vouchers are available to purchase if you are expecting friends or family to visit you at your accommodation. The visitor must be visiting you, not someone else at Warwick.

Day Visitor Vouchers

Day visitor vouchers may be purchased for £2.20 for use in the following car parks only:

  • Gibbet Hill
  • Lynchgate
  • Cryfield Village

Day visitor vouchers are valid from 8am to 6pm, Monday to Sunday (excluding special event parking such as Open Days, for which these vouchers are not valid).

How to purchase visitor vouchers

  1. Complete the Visitor Vouchers request form.
  2. Your request will be reviewed and processed by your site reception.
  3. Once ready, you will be contacted on how and when to collect your voucher(s).

Terms & Conditions

  • Vouchers are valid only for the date shown.
  • A voucher is only valid when all requested information has been completed in ink.
  • Vouchers are not refundable and cannot be exchanged for cash.
  • Vouchers must be clearly displayed on the vehicle dashboard.
  • The University reserves the right to withdraw these arrangements without notice.

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Feedback

feedback.Did the text answer your query?: No, the page is about visitor vouchers and doesn't address how to request permission to make changes to my flat.
feedback.Was there anything that could have been: It wasn't clear that this page is not related to flat improvement requests or permissions.
feedback.Is there any way this text could be impr: Including a link or information about how to request permission for flat modifications would make it more helpful for my specific needs.

ai_feedback.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Feedback

feedback.Did the text answer your query?: No, the page is about visitor vouchers, not about applying for permission to make changes to my flat.
feedback.Was there anything that could have been: Yes, it wasn't clear that this page is unrelated to flat improvement applications; I expected information on how to request permission for upgrades.
feedback.Is there any way this text could be impr: Including a link or section specifically about applying for flat modifications would help me find the relevant information more easily.

ai_business_case.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - Medway - Business Case
ai_business_case.letter:
To the CEO,

Subject: Recommendations for Enhancing User Experience and Operational Efficiency Based on Customer Feedback

Overview:
The recent user feedback and content review highlight significant issues with the current web page structure and content relevance. Specifically, the page currently provides information about visitor vouchers, which does not align with the needs of customers seeking guidance on flat modification requests. This mismatch not only causes user confusion but may also lead to inefficient inquiry handling by staff, ultimately impacting service quality and increasing administrative costs.

Findings:
1. Customer Persona & Needs:
- David, a typical customer, is comfortable with online forms and values clarity and simplicity.
- His primary goal is to request permission for minor flat modifications, such as installing a new kitchen or adding handrails.
- His main concern is limited communication delays and ensuring he remains compliant with tenancy rules.

2. Feedback & Issues:
- The content does not answer the specific query about requesting flat modifications.
- The page content is about visitor vouchers, which is irrelevant to his request.
- Important instructions and contact information related to flat modification permissions are missing.
- The irrelevant information could frustrate users, leading to increased calls or emails, thereby taxing customer service resources.

3. Improvements Proposed:
- Explicitly clarify the purpose of the page with notices such as "This page pertains to visitor voucher purchases" versus "Requesting permission for flat modifications."
- Include direct links or clear pathways to the relevant flat improvement request pages.
- Ensure contact details and expected timelines for responses are prominently displayed on the correct pages.

Recommended Actions:
- Develop dedicated, clearly labeled pages for different service categories (e.g., flat improvement requests, visitor vouchers).
- On each page, include unambiguous notices confirming the page's purpose.
- Embed direct links to the appropriate forms and contact points related to flat modifications.
- Implement a short FAQ or guidance section that emphasizes the steps and expected response times for flat requests.

Impact:
Implementing these improvements will significantly enhance user experience by making relevant information easily accessible, reducing confusion, and minimizing unnecessary inquiries. This targeted clarity will streamline operational workflows, shorten response times, and reduce administrative overhead, thereby saving the council money.

Conclusion:
By realigning web content with customer needs and clarifying the purpose of each page, we can provide a more user-centric service. This approach will foster greater customer satisfaction while improving service efficiency—an essential step forward in digital transformation and resource optimization.

Respectfully,

[Your Name]
Web Usability & Service Efficiency Lead
